sentence.text: We investigated glioma-associated oncogene protein-1 (Gli-1) expression in human esophageal carcinoma tissue and the inhibition of cyclopamine on EC9706 esophageal carcinoma cell growth.
MATERIAL AND METHODS Gli-1 in tumor tissue was measured by immunohistochemistry (IHC).

RESULTS Gli-1 was associated with patient age, gender, lymphatic metastasis, tumor recurrence, and stage, with significantly (PAAAA0.05) positive correlations with age, lymphatic metastasis, tumor recurrence, and stage.
CONCLUSIONS Gli-1 is highly expressed in human esophageal carcinoma, and could be a marker for use in assessing tumor stage and the deciding on treatment target
